euphoria: bull run unstoppable momentum green everywhere
new highs breaking records celebration trading floor
rally extending gains accumulating wealth building
breakout confirmed resistance shattered bulls charging
buying frenzy demand overwhelming supply exhausted
euphoric traders high fives champagne popping
melt up parabolic rise vertical chart
FOMO peak everyone buying late stage
greed maximum risk ignored caution abandoned
bubble territory valuations stretched skeptics silenced
confidence: steady uptrend buyers in control patient accumulation
bullish sentiment optimism spreading portfolio allocation
dip buying opportunity weakness absorbed quickly
support holding buyers defending price floor
momentum building volume confirming price advance
trend intact higher highs higher lows
risk on appetite strong allocation increasing
accumulation phase smart money buying quietly

despair: bear market crushing losses portfolio devastation
crash accelerating losses compounding fear maximum
free fall no support prices collapsing
blood in streets extreme pessimism despair
margin calls forced selling cascade effect
dead money trapped positions no hope
depression phase giving up abandoning positions
extinction event traders blown out finished
fear: sell off accelerating losses mounting pressure
distribution phase smart money exiting quietly
risk off flight to safety defensive positioning
cash is king liquidity hoarding defensive
lower lows lower highs trend confirmed down

consolidation: indecision neither bulls nor bears control
channel trading support resistance ping pong
mean reversion pulls extremes back center
low volatility quiet before storm calm
uncertainty: wait and see mode sitting on hands

extreme: volatility explosion wild price swings chaos
flash crash sudden collapse rapid recovery
circuit breaker halt trading suspended limit
gap risk overnight moves unexpected shocked
tail risk event black swan materialized
liquidity vacuum bids disappeared thin market
elevated: vix elevated fear gauge warning signal
stop losses widened risk management adjusted

turningPoints: exhaustion gap final push before reversal
divergence warning momentum fading price rising
confirmation: follow through day trend confirmed valid

supplyShock: supply disruption prices spiking shortage panic
weather damage crop loss yield reduction
strike action production halted labor dispute
squeeze developing shorts trapped supply tight
demandShock: demand destruction prices too high rationing
